fields.name: database_name
fields.doc: The name of the database that contains this function.

fields.name: database_oid
fields.doc: N/A

fields.name: schema_name
fields.doc: The SQL name of the schema where the function resides.

fields.name: function_name
fields.doc: The SQL name of the function.

fields.name: function_type
fields.doc: The function kind. Value is one of: table,scalar,aggregate,pragma,macro

fields.name: description
fields.doc: Description of this function

fields.name: comment
fields.doc: N/A

fields.name: tags
fields.doc: N/A

fields.name: return_type
fields.doc: The logical data type name of the returned value. Applicable for scalar and aggregate functions.

fields.name: parameters
fields.doc: If the function has parameters, the list of parameter names.

fields.name: parameter_types
fields.doc: If the function has parameters, a list of logical data type names corresponding to the parameter list.

fields.name: varargs
fields.doc: The name of the data type in case the function has a variable number of arguments, or NULL if the function does not have a variable number of arguments.

fields.name: macro_definition
fields.doc: If this is a macro, the SQL expression that defines it.

fields.name: has_side_effects
fields.doc: false if this is a pure function. true if this function changes the database state (like sequence functions nextval() and curval()).

fields.name: internal
fields.doc: N/A

fields.name: function_oid
fields.doc: The internal identifier for this function

fields.name: example
fields.doc: N/A

fields.name: stability
fields.doc: N/A
